name: obliterating
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
obliterate
[ T often passive ] to remove all signs of something, either by destroying it or by covering it so that it cannot be seen: The missile strike was devastating - the target was totally obliterated. All of a sudden the view was obliterated by the fog.
[ T ] to make an idea or feeling disappear completely: Maybe she gets drunk to obliterate painful memories.
